unnormalised: India keenly awaits the Chandrayaan-3 mission’s landing, expected on 23/08/2023 at approx. 6:04 PM IST. All eyes are glued to the screens, hoping for a successful soft landing on the moon’s South Pole. It's a moment of great anticipation and national pride for every Indian, from the chai wallah down the street to the scientists at ISRO.
normalised: India keenly awaits the Chandrayaan-3 mission's landing, expected on twenty third August two thousand and twenty three at approximately six four P-M I-S-T. All eyes are glued to the screens, hoping for a successful soft landing on the moon's South Pole. It's a moment of great anticipation and national pride for every Indian, from the chai wallah down the street to the scientists at I-S-R-O.

unnormalised: Leading up to the big event, news channels are running constant updates. They're dissecting everything from the trajectory to the landing procedure, sometimes it feels like over and over again! But it keeps the excitement high, doesn't it? Experts predict optimal conditions, referencing data from earlier missions and simulations run up till 22/08/2023, 11:59 PM.
normalised: Leading up to the big event, news channels are running constant updates. They're dissecting everything from the trajectory to the landing procedure, sometimes it feels like over and over again! But it keeps the excitement high, doesn't it? Experts predict optimal conditions, referencing data from earlier missions and simulations run up till twenty second August two thousand and twenty three, eleven fifty nine P-M.

unnormalised: Remember Chandrayaan-2? It was heart-breaking. That mission aimed for a landing around 07/09/2019. But this time, ISRO seems better prepared. They've incorporated lessons learned, tweaked the software, and added extra safety measures. Fingers crossed this time!
normalised: Remember Chandrayaan-2? It was heart-breaking. That mission aimed for a landing around seventh September two thousand and nineteen. But this time, I-S-R-O seems better prepared. They've incorporated lessons learned, tweaked the software, and added extra safety measures. Fingers crossed this time!

unnormalised: Social media is buzzing too! #Chandrayaan3 is trending everywhere. People are sharing messages of support, posting illustrations, and even making memes to lighten the mood. Some are even suggesting celebrations starting 24/08/2023 should the mission succeed. Talk about optimistic!
normalised: Social media is buzzing too! hash Chandrayaan3 is trending everywhere. People are sharing messages of support, posting illustrations, and even making memes to lighten the mood. Some are even suggesting celebrations starting twenty fourth August two thousand and twenty three should the mission succeed. Talk about optimistic!

unnormalised: According to reports from the control room, the final descent will take about 20 minutes. Those 20 minutes will feel like an eternity, I'm sure. The whole nation will be holding its breath, saying a silent prayer, hoping for a successful touchdown. Keep the TV volume up!
normalised: According to reports from the control room, the final descent will take about twenty minutes. Those twenty minutes will feel like an eternity, I'm sure. The whole nation will be holding its breath, saying a silent prayer, hoping for a successful touchdown. Keep the T-V volume up!

unnormalised: Whether it lands perfectly at 6:04 PM or there are some minor adjustments made at the last minute, this mission represents India's growing prowess in space exploration. It’s not just about the science; it’s about inspiring future generations of Indian scientists and engineers. Good luck, Chandrayaan-3!
normalised: Whether it lands perfectly at six four P-M or there are some minor adjustments made at the last minute, this mission represents India's growing prowess in space exploration. It's not just about the science; it's about inspiring future generations of Indian scientists and engineers. Good luck, Chandrayaan-3!
